isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 5000i, 9100i, 9200i, 9400i, 9900i MODELS - Starting 03/01/1999 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - BLOWER MOTOR ASSEMBLY - CAB (LOCATED IN BLEND-AIR UNIT)

svcproc.title: BLOWER MOTOR ASSEMBLY - CAB (LOCATED IN BLEND-AIR UNIT)

step1.para: Make sure the key switch and blower motor switch are in the OFF position.
Remove the passenger seat and Blend-Air unit cover. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Remove .
Remove two screws from the front side of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 38).
Remove the cab blend-door actuator. Refer to CAB BLEND-DOOR ACTUATOR, Remove .
Remove two screws from the blower motor housing where it is fastened to the inside of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 39).
Disconnect the electrical connector from the motor.

caution.para: In the following step, take care not to damage the resistors while handling the blower speed resistor housing.

step1.para: Slide the blower speed resistor housing up and out of the Blend-Air unit and carefully lay it out of the way ( Figure 36).
Slide the blower housing back and up to remove ( Figure 40).
If the motor is to be replaced, remove the five screws that secure the blower motor assembly to the blower housing and remove the blower motor assembly ( Figure 41).
If the blower wheel must be separated from motor, to allow replacement of individual parts, remove the clip from the end of the motor shaft and slide the wheel off of the motor shaft.
Inspect the blower wheel for damage. Replace if damaged.

figure.caption: Figure 41. Screws Securing Blower Motor Assembly

step1.para: If the blower wheel was removed, install the wheel onto the motor shaft until it bottoms out; then, install the clip onto the motor shaft to hold the wheel in position.
Install the blower motor assembly into the blower housing using the five screws removed previously ( Figure 41).
Position blower motor housing in Blend-Air unit ( Figure 40), and reconnect the electrical connector to the motor.
While holding the blower motor housing in place, install and tighten two screws through the front side of the Blend-Air unit into the blower motor housing ( Figure 38).
Install and tighten the two screws that secure the blower motor housing to the inside of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 39).
Slide the blower speed resistor housing back into the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 36).
Install the cab blend-door actuator into the Blend-Air unit. Refer to CAB BLEND-DOOR ACTUATOR, Install .

note.para: In the following step, to verify correct blower operation at the air duct outlets, the cover must be in place on the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Test operation of blower unit.
Install Blend-Air unit cover and passenger seat. Refer to BLEND AIR UNIT COVER, Install .
